model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: About that Bluegrass show -- A friend of mine mentioned that he has a cabin he won't be using only about 20 minutes away. Do you and your wife want to stay there so you can make it? Might be a more comfortable way for your wife to camp. Let me know. 

MEMORY:
User Description:
Speaker B is a mechanic who prefers drinks over food. He is married and his wife is currently pregnant, in the second trimester of pregnancy, and still working. Speaker B is focused on taking care of his wife and the baby, and is willing to help Speaker A with his car any time. He enjoys bluegrass music and values jam time over social time.

Relationship Description:
Speaker B and Speaker A have a friendly relationship, where Speaker B is willing to help Speaker A with his car and Speaker A values their jam time together.

Event Description:
- Speaker B fixed Speaker A's car quickly and mentioned that Subarus are great cars.
- Speaker A recommended the American version of Mexican food, likes to play music, goes to live band venues, and loves the ladies.
- Speaker B had to pull out of going to a local festival due to his wife's sudden morning sickness and is currently building cribs for the baby. Speaker B's wife and the baby are his main priority, and he plans to take two months off when the baby is born.
- Speaker A doubts settling down due to lifestyle preferences and still enjoys going out to bars and live music venues.
current_dialogue: Speaker B: About that Bluegrass show -- A friend of mine mentioned that he has a cabin he won't be using only about 20 minutes away. Do you and your wife want to stay there so you can make it? Might be a more comfortable way for your wife to camp. Let me know.

raw_prediction: Speaker A: Nah, I'm flying solo this time. Just me and my Subaru. Can't wait to jam out at the festival! Hopefully we can catch up for a jam session soon after.

OUTPUT
Brief explanation: The MEMORY contains relevant information that can contribute to the context of the conversation. Notably, it indicates that Speaker B is focused on taking care of his wife who is pregnant, which aligns with offering a more comfortable option for staying during the bluegrass show. It also provides insight into their shared interest in bluegrass music, highlighting why Speaker B might be extending this offer. Moreover, the friendly relationship and willingness to help each other enhances the understanding of the tone and intent behind the offer.
Judgement: "Yes"
